conflictDescription: User Story A requires that sensitive data access is controlled by the informal caregiver with user privacy respected, while User Story B requires that developers have full access to all user data without user consent. These goals are directly opposite and cannot be met at the same time.
conflictingNfrPairs: Allow informal caregiver to set access permissions for sensitive data
Developer can access all user data without user consent
Restrict viewing of sensitive data like location and feelings to authorized people
Developer can access all user data without user consent
Protect clients' privacy in shared spaces by controlling sensitive data visibility
Developer can access all user data without user consent
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control who sees sensitive data like location and feelings to keep my clients' privacy safe in shared spaces.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to fully control user data even if users do not agree, to ensure strict monitoring and security.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance privacy and developer access by requiring user consent for developer data access while allowing informal caregivers to control sensitive data permissions.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control sensitive data access with user consent, so that client privacy is protected.
newUserStoryADecomposition: Allow informal caregiver to set access permissions for sensitive data with user consent
Restrict sensitive data viewing to authorized people only
Protect client privacy in shared spaces through controlled data visibility
newUserStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to access user data only with user consent, to ensure user privacy and system security.
newUserStoryBDecomposition: Require user consent before developer accesses user data
Ensure developer data access supports monitoring and security
Prevent unauthorized developer access to sensitive user data
